Named colors from the ColorBrewer palettes

Source: R/data.R
rcb_colors.Rd

Shorthand color names assigned to selected colors from the ColorBrewer palettes.

rcb_colors

Format

A data frame (tibble) with 24 observations and 2 variables.

rcb_name

Character variable of names.

rcb_code

Character variable of hex color codes.

Source

Cynthia Brewer (http://colorbrewer2.org) and RColorBrewer (https://cran.r-project.org/package=RColorBrewer).

Details

This dataset provides convenient access to selected ColorBrewer palettes: diverging brown-bluegreen (BrBG) with 8 levels; diverging purple-green (PRGn) with 8 levels; and sequential gray (Greys) with the middle four of 6 levels.

The color names have the form "level_hue" with 4 saturation levels (dark, mid, light, pale) and 5 hues (Br, BG, PR, Gn, Gray or Grey).

Examples

rcb_colors
#> # A tibble: 24 x 2
#>    rcb_name rcb_code
#>    <chr>    <chr>   
#>  1 dark_Br  #8C510A 
#>  2 mid_Br   #BF812D 
#>  3 light_Br #DFC27D 
#>  4 pale_Br  #F6E8C3 
#>  5 pale_BG  #C7EAE5 
#>  6 light_BG #80CDC1 
#>  7 mid_BG   #35978F 
#>  8 dark_BG  #01665E 
#>  9 dark_PR  #762A83 
#> 10 mid_PR   #9970AB 
#> # ... with 14 more rows
rcb("dark_Br")
#> [1] "#8C510A"
rcb("light_Gn")
#> [1] "#A6DBA0"
